020package org.tquadrat.foundation.javacomposer;
021
022import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
023import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireNonNullArgument;
024
025import javax.lang.model.type.TypeMirror;
026import java.lang.reflect.Type;
027import java.util.List;
028import java.util.Optional;
029
030import org.apiguardian.api.API;
031import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
032import org.tquadrat.foundation.javacomposer.internal.TypeNameImpl;
033
034/**
035 *  <p>{@summary The specification for a representation of any type in Java's
036 *  type system, plus {@code void}.} The implementations of this interface
037 *  class are identifiers for primitive types like {@code int} and raw
038 *  reference types like
039 *  {@link String}
040 *  and
041 *  {@link java.util.List List}.
042 *  It also identifies composite types like
043 *  {@code char[]}
044 *  and
045 *  {@link java.util.Set Set&lt;Long&gt;}.</p>
046 *  <p>Type names are dumb identifiers only and do not model the values they
047 *  name. For example, the type name for {@code java.lang.List} doesn't know
048 *  about the
049 *  {@link java.util.List#size() size()}
050 *  method, the fact that lists are collections, or even that it accepts a
051 *  single type parameter.</p>
052 *  <p>Instances of this class are immutable value objects that implement
053 *  {@link Object#equals(Object) equals()}
054 *  and
055 *  {@link Object#hashCode()}
056 *  properly.</p>
057 *
058 *  <h2>Referencing existing types</h2>
059 *  <p>Primitives and {@code void} are constants that can be referenced directly:
060 *  see for example
061 *  {@link Primitives#INT},
062 *  {@link Primitives#DOUBLE},
063 *  and
064 *  {@link Primitives#VOID}.</p>
065 *  <p>In an annotation processor, a type name instance for a type mirror can
066 *  be obtained by calling
067 *  {@link #from(TypeMirror)}.
068 *  In reflection code,
069 *  {@link #from(Type)}
070 *  can be used.</p>
071 *
072 *  <h2>Defining new types</h2>
073 *  <p>New reference types like {@code com.example.HelloWorld} can be created
074 *  with
075 *  {@link ClassName#from(CharSequence,CharSequence,CharSequence...)}.
076 *  To build composite types like {@code char[]} and {@code Set<Long>}, the
077 *  factory methods on
078 *  {@link ArrayTypeName},
079 *  {@link ParameterizedTypeName},
080 *  {@link TypeVariableName},
081 *  and
082 *  {@link WildcardTypeName}
083 *  should be used.</p>
084 *
085 *  @author Square,Inc.
086 *  @modified Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
087 *  @version $Id: TypeName.java 1085 2024-01-05 16:23:28Z tquadrat $
088 *  @since 0.0.5
089 *
090 *  @UMLGraph.link
091 */
092@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: TypeName.java 1085 2024-01-05 16:23:28Z tquadrat $" )
093@API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
094public sealed interface TypeName
095    permits ArrayTypeName, ClassName, ParameterizedTypeName, TypeVariableName, WildcardTypeName, TypeNameImpl
096{
097        /*---------*\
098    ====** Methods **==========================================================
099        \*---------*/
100    /**
101     *  Creates a new instance for an implementation of {@code TypeName} as a
102     *  copy of this one, but with the given annotations added.
103     *
104     *  @param  annotations The annotations.
105     *  @return The new instance.
106     */
107    public default TypeName annotated( final AnnotationSpec... annotations )
108    {
109        return annotated( List.of( requireNonNullArgument( annotations, "annotations" ) ) );
110    }   //  annotated()
111
112    /**
113     *  Creates a new instance for an implementation of {@code TypeName} as a
114     *  copy of this one, but with the given annotations added.
115     *
116     *  @param  annotations The annotations.
117     *  @return The new instance.
118     */
119    public TypeName annotated( final List<AnnotationSpec> annotations );
120
121    /**
122     *  Returns the array component for the given type name; the return value
123     *  is empty if the given type is not an array.
124     *
125     *  @param  type    The type name.
126     *  @return An instance of
127     *      {@link Optional}
128     *      that holds the type name of the array component.
129     */
130    @SuppressWarnings( "ClassReferencesSubclass" )
131    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
132    public static Optional<TypeName> arrayComponent( final TypeName type )
133    {
134        return type instanceof final ArrayTypeName arrayType ? Optional.of( arrayType.componentType() ) : Optional.empty();
135    }   //  arrayComponent()
136
137    /**
138     *  Returns the given type name as an array; the return value is empty if
139     *  it is not an array.
140     *
141     *  @param  type    The type name.
142     *  @return An instance of
143     *      {@link Optional}
144     *      that holds the array type name.
145     */
146    @SuppressWarnings( {"ClassReferencesSubclass", "StaticMethodOnlyUsedInOneClass"} )
147    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
148    public static Optional<ArrayTypeName> asArray( final TypeName type )
149    {
150        final var retValue = TypeNameImpl.asArray( type ).map( a -> (ArrayTypeName) a );
151
152        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
153        return retValue;
154    }   //  asArray()
155
156    /**
157     *  Returns a boxed type if this is a primitive type (like
158     *  {@link Integer}
159     *  for {@code int}) or {@code void}. Returns this type if boxing doesn't
160     *  apply.
161     *
162     *  @return The boxed if necessary, otherwise this.
163     */
164    public TypeName box();
165
166    /**
167     *  {@inheritDoc}
168     */
169    @Override
170    public boolean equals( final Object o );
171
172    /**
173     *  Returns a type name equivalent to that from the given
174     *  {@link TypeMirror}
175     *  instance.
176     *
177     *  @param  mirror  The given type mirror instance.
178     *  @return The respective type name.
179     */
180    @SuppressWarnings( "ClassReferencesSubclass" )
181    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.2.0" )
182    public static TypeName from( final TypeMirror mirror )
183    {
184        final var retValue = TypeNameImpl.from( mirror );
185
186        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
187        return retValue;
188    }   //  from()
189
190    /**
191     *  Returns a type name equivalent to that of the given
192     *  {@link Type}
193     *  instance.
194     *
195     *  @param  type    The type.
196     *  @return The respective type name for the given {@code Type} instance.
197     */
198    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.2.0" )
199    public static TypeName from( final Type type ) { return TypeNameImpl.from( type ); }
200
201    /**
202     *  {@inheritDoc}
203     */
204    @Override
205    public int hashCode();
206
207    /**
208     *  Checks whether this type name is annotated.
209     *
210     *  @return {@code true} if it is annotated, {@code false} otherwise.
211     */
212    public boolean isAnnotated();
213
214    /**
215     *  Checks whether this type name represents a box primitive type.
216     *
217     *  @return {@code true} if this is a boxed primitive type like
218     *      {@link Integer}.
219     *      {@code false} for all other types including unboxed primitives and
220     *      {@link java.lang.Void}.
221     */
222    public boolean isBoxedPrimitive();
223
224    /**
225     *  Checks whether this type name represents a primitive type.
226     *
227     *  @return {@code true} if this is a primitive type like {@code int}.
228     *      {@code false} for all other types including boxed primitives and
229     *      {@code void}.
230     */
231    public boolean isPrimitive();
232
233    /**
234     *  {@inheritDoc}
235     */
236    @Override
237    public String toString();
238
239    /**
240     *  Returns an unboxed type if this is a boxed primitive type (like
241     *  {@code int} for
242     *  {@link Integer})
243     *  or {@code Void}. Returns this type if it is already unboxed.
244     *
245     *  @return The unboxed type if applicable, or this.
246     *  @throws UnsupportedOperationException   This type isn't eligible for
247     *      unboxing.
248     */
249    public TypeName unbox();
250
251    /**
252     *  Creates a new instance for an implementation of {@code TypeName} as a
253     *  copy of this one, but without any annotations.
254     *
255     *  @return The new instance.
256     */
257    public TypeName withoutAnnotations();
258}
259//  interface TypeName
260
261/*
262 *  End of File
263 */
